Content:
Hi! I want to freshen up my bike before this years season, and one of the things i'm looking to improve is some of the paint in the bike. I will attach a photo of one of the problem areas. I am very inexperienced with any painting job, especially on vehicles, and i would love some pointers.
The bike is a 2019 Kawasaki Z125 (BR125K). The black coating by the front brake rotor is peeling off quite bad.
How can it prevent it from worsening and how should i go about fixing it? Type of paint, sanding etc.
Appreciate any kind of help and pointers!
Thanks!
